author: Fivestar4everMVP
created_time: October 07, 2022, 04:58:17 AMLast edit: December 16, 2023, 06:47:53 PM by Fivestar4everMVP
content: News circulating around this morning is that Binance smart chain has experienced an exploit and the chain is currently halted.Rumor is confirmed by reliable sources.Sources:https://twitter.com/bnbchain/status/1578148078636650496https://coinmarketcap.com/alexandria/article/binance-smart-chain-suspends-service-as-estimated-100m-drained-in-exploit

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: very surprising this happened to the Binance smart chain. that's an estimate of a very large number. but it looks like Binance has also announced that all funds are safe.https://twitter.com/BNBCHAIN/status/1578152039455916033a notification has also been pinned for access https://bscscan.com/

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Awaklara on October 07, 2022, 05:35:59 AMvery surprising this happened to the Binance smart chain.Why surprising? It has happened before to other popular altcoins before, so it was just a matter of time to happen with BSC as well. I just hope people will take it as a warning that BSC is not the best blockchain to keep your money on, but knowing how people tend to have short memory I doubt that will happen and soon this will be forgotten.Quote from: Awaklara on October 07, 2022, 05:35:59 AM but it looks like Binance has also announced that all funds are safe.Of course they announced the funds are safe, I wouldn't expect them to say anything else.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: Awaklara on October 07, 2022, 05:35:59 AMvery surprising this happened to the Binance smart chain. that's an estimate of a very large number. but it looks like Binance has also announced that all funds are safe.If there are about 100 Million dollars become hacked for the exploit then how the fund can remain safe? Then who lost the funds all funds lost by the binance or someone from outside of the Binance? It seems something suspicious. And if loss of funds of users then binance will never take responsibility.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on October 07, 2022, 08:16:06 AMIf there are about 100 Million dollars become hacked for the exploit then how the fund can remain safe? Then who lost the funds all funds lost by the binance or someone from outside of the Binance? It seems something suspicious. And if loss of funds of users then binance will never take responsibility.The part of the funds that have not arrived in centralized exchanges cannot be moved right now, since that blockchain is halted.I would not be surprised if a rollback or (if that's possible) an alternate chain will be made leaving out the transaction(s) related to the hack.I will add this, since it tells is very good:Quote from: hugeblack on October 07, 2022, 08:04:37 AMIn Binance Smart Chain they relies on 21 validators with Proof of Staked Authority (PoSA) which mean that those 21 validators who can suspend the network, delete coins, add new one, and more.Note that most or all of these 21 are directly or indirectly managed by Binance.

comments.body: Quote from: Awaklara on October 07, 2022, 05:35:59 AMvery surprising this happened to the Binance smart chain. that's an estimate of a very large number. but it looks like Binance has also announced that all funds are safe.<cut>Not surprising at all. comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on October 07, 2022, 08:16:06 AMThen who lost the funds all funds lost by the binance or someone from outside of the Binance? It seems something suspicious. And if loss of funds of users then binance will never take responsibility.According to Binance, its not that hacker took someone else's money, but instead BSC was exploited and attacker created bunch of BNB out of thin air. Then again, if someone can do that you should ask yourself how much is your BNB actually worth and should you even have any. Quote from: NeuroticFish on October 07, 2022, 08:34:36 AMI would not be surprised if a rollback or (if that's possible) an alternate chain will be made leaving out the transaction(s) related to the hack.This is what BSC people said on the matter, no mention of rollback.Quote from: https://www.bnbchain.org/en/blog/bnb-chain-ecosystem-update/What happens next?  There will be on-chain governance votes to determine the following four actions for the common good of BNB:    What to do with the hacked funds, freeze or not to freeze?    Whether to use BNB Auto-Burn to cover the remaining hacked funds, or not?    A Whitehat program for future bugs found, $1M for each significant bug found.    A Bounty for catching hackers, up to 10% of the recovered funds.The BSC validator voting function for general opinions will be switched on in the next few days via an upgrade of BNB Beacon Chain.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: When everything is taken into account, it seems to me that from time to time CZ and the team perform a small performance to show that "all funds are safe", which is actually the only thing that will remain behind this story. Cheap PR that costs nothing more than a few tweets, job done successfully.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: Awaklara on October 07, 2022, 05:35:59 AMvery surprising this happened to the Binance smart chain. Nope, not that surprising at all. Binance was already hacked before so, another sequence of hack is no longer a surprising moment to those that have been aware of it. Well, if this new to you then it's really surprising but for everyone that have seen them getting hacked before, nothing new.Quote from: Lucius on October 07, 2022, 10:39:44 AMCheap PR that costs nothing more than a few tweets, job done successfully.You said it so, and even there's no other team that will work for it just to tell their customers shouldn't worry at all. By just a post from his own account and while his social media manager doing all the tweets/posts, everything's done.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Binance is centralized blockchain which they have full control on the situation. I believe they can easily freeze the hacker wallet address or there blockchain just to recover the hack funds. CZ has a dedicated team for crypto security especially on large scale hacked like this. I don’t read the article yet but centralized exchange works that way and it’s one of the advantage of centralized blockchain in time like this since they can target hacker wallet address to freeze as long as the issue was reported earlier.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: looks like the BSC is up and running again. there is no notice in bsc scan anymore. Binance's official Twitter has also announced that the BSC has started running.I tried to access the BSC Scan, and it doesn't feel as heavy as it did a few hours ago. even BSC will not display the amount of BNB balance in our address.somehow Binance claims all funds are safe. but now everything seems to be working normally.

comments.body: Quote from: Awaklara on October 07, 2022, 05:35:59 AMvery surprising this happened to the Binance smart chain. that's an estimate of a very large number. but it looks like Binance has also announced that all funds are safe.I am surprised you're surprised Binance smart chain got hacked. comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: shasan on October 07, 2022, 07:04:36 PMIf the hacker hacked 100 million dollars and can't use 70-80 million dollars means they become successful in stealing 70 to 80 percent of the hacking amount. If they could prevent or solve the problem within a short time then it could be safe for the site as well as for the users who use bnb smart chain as well as Binance.The hackers knew that the binance team might halt bsc's blockchain, so they tried to move the funds as fast as they could and the hackers were very successful.
